title: How to Make Slow Cooker Cheesecake

steps.headline: Crumble up 12 graham crackers.
steps.description: Crumble up the graham crackers with 1/4 cup (56.69 g) of sugar in a food processor. If you don't have a food processor, you can put the ingredients into a zip-lock bag and use a rolling pin to crumble it up into a fine dust. Sugar will add to the sweetness to your crust and will also help bind the crackers together.

steps.headline: Mix in melted butter.
steps.description: Transfer the graham crackers and sugar to a large mixing bowl and add 6 tablespoons (85 g) of melted butter to the bowl. Knead the mixture together with your hands until it thickens. If it is too crumbly, add a teaspoon of water until it becomes pliable.

steps.headline: Press the crust into a pie pan.
steps.description: Put the mixture in the middle of a baking pan or pie pan and press down on it to form the crust. Use your hands to press the mixture firmly and evenly so that it cooks evenly.

steps.headline: Bake the crust at 375 °F (191 °C) for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Cook the pie crust until it becomes golden brown. It should also smell fragrant. When it's done baking, take it out and allow it to cool for an hour before filling it with your cheesecake filling. If you plan on making the rest of your cheesecake later, then you can cover it and place it in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Mix the cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and sugar and fold the ingredients together using a spatula or spoon. Continue mixing until all the ingredients are well incorporated and the cream cheese is soft. You can also mix things together in a food processor.

steps.headline: Add eggs to the bowl.
steps.description: Crack one egg at a time and whisk it in the cream cheese and sugar bowl. Make sure that the eggs are incorporated fully before adding the next egg.

steps.headline: Add two cups of water to the bottom of your slow cooker.
steps.description: You should use a 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker when making this recipe. Add water to the bottom of your crock pot and set a rack on the bottom of the cooker. The water should come up about a half an inch from the bottom of your slow cooker.

steps.headline: Fill your crust with your cheesecake filling.
steps.description: Take your graham cracker crust and fill it with the cream cheese, eggs, and sugar filling that you just created. Use a spatula to evenly distribute the filling throughout the crust and to help you level out the top of your cheesecake.

steps.headline: Cook in your slow cooker on high for 2 1/2 hours.
steps.description: Set the dial on the slow cooker to high and place the lid on it. Do not lift the lid while the cake cooks or it may come out underdone. If you pierce the center of the cake with a knife and it has a watery consistency, you'll have to cook your cheesecake longer.

steps.headline: Allow the cheesecake to cool.
steps.description: Let the cheesecake cool down in your slow cooker for one hour before trying to handle it. Once it's cooled, take it out and cover it with plastic wrap before putting it in your refrigerator to set. You should allow your cake to cool in the fridge for at least four hours before trying to serve it.

steps.headline: Mix melted butter, cinnamon, 1 tsp (4.2 g) of sugar, and salt in a bowl.
steps.description: The dry ingredients will soak up some of the melted butter. Mix these ingredients together using a spatula or spoon. Continue to mix and fold all ingredients until they are well incorporated.

steps.headline: Beat in the sour cream, vanilla extract, and eggs.
steps.description: Add one egg at a time to your mixture. Once the egg has been added, mix it together using a fork or whisk before repeating the process on the next egg. If you have a mechanical mixer or food processor, you can also use that to help blend things together. Fold these ingredients together with the other ingredients until the mixture becomes soft and fluffy. You can also beat the eggs in a separate bowl before adding them to your cream cheese filling for a lighter and fluffier finish.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into your pie crust.
steps.description: Pour the filling that you just created into your readily made pie crust. Push the filling around until it's evenly distributed over the crust. Smooth out the top of the cheesecake with a spatula.

steps.headline: Fill your slow cooker with a 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) of water.
steps.description: Use 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker and fill the bottom of it with water. The level of the water should only come up a half an inch off the bottom of your slow cooker.

steps.headline: Cook the cake in the slow-cooker on high for two hours.
steps.description: Place the pie pan inside of the slow-cooker. Make sure that the pie itself does not get wet from the water. Set the dial on high, cover the cake, and continue to cook it for two hours. If you are scared that your cake will get wet, you can use a meat rack or cooking rack that comes with some slow-cookers to elevate your pie pan out of the water. This rack will fit on the bottom of your slow-cooker.

steps.headline: Allow the cake to cool.
steps.description: Let the cake cool inside of the slow-cooker once it's done cooking. Afterward, carefully take it out and let it cool down to room temperature before placing the cake in the refrigerator overnight before serving it. To add a special flair to your cheesecake, top it with fresh fruit or melted chocolate or peanut butter.

text: Creating the Graham Cracker Crust Crumble up 12 graham crackers. Crumble up the graham crackers with 1/4 cup (56.69 g) of sugar in a food processor. If you don't have a food processor, you can put the ingredients into a zip-lock bag and use a rolling pin to crumble it up into a fine dust. Sugar will add to the sweetness to your crust and will also help bind the crackers together. Mix in melted butter. Transfer the graham crackers and sugar to a large mixing bowl and add 6 tablespoons (85 g) of melted butter to the bowl. Knead the mixture together with your hands until it thickens. If it is too crumbly, add a teaspoon of water until it becomes pliable. Press the crust into a pie pan. Put the mixture in the middle of a baking pan or pie pan and press down on it to form the crust. Use your hands to press the mixture firmly and evenly so that it cooks evenly. Bake the crust at 375 °F (191 °C) for 8 to 10 minutes. Cook the pie crust until it becomes golden brown. It should also smell fragrant. When it's done baking, take it out and allow it to cool for an hour before filling it with your cheesecake filling. If you plan on making the rest of your cheesecake later, then you can cover it and place it in the refrigerator. Making Simple Cheesecake Mix the cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and sugar and fold the ingredients together using a spatula or spoon. Continue mixing until all the ingredients are well incorporated and the cream cheese is soft. You can also mix things together in a food processor. Add eggs to the bowl. Crack one egg at a time and whisk it in the cream cheese and sugar bowl. Make sure that the eggs are incorporated fully before adding the next egg. Add two cups of water to the bottom of your slow cooker. You should use a 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker when making this recipe. Add water to the bottom of your crock pot and set a rack on the bottom of the cooker. The water should come up about a half an inch from the bottom of your slow cooker. Fill your crust with your cheesecake filling. Take your graham cracker crust and fill it with the cream cheese, eggs, and sugar filling that you just created. Use a spatula to evenly distribute the filling throughout the crust and to help you level out the top of your cheesecake. Cook in your slow cooker on high for 2 1/2 hours. Set the dial on the slow cooker to high and place the lid on it. Do not lift the lid while the cake cooks or it may come out underdone. If you pierce the center of the cake with a knife and it has a watery consistency, you'll have to cook your cheesecake longer. Allow the cheesecake to cool. Let the cheesecake cool down in your slow cooker for one hour before trying to handle it. Once it's cooled, take it out and cover it with plastic wrap before putting it in your refrigerator to set. You should allow your cake to cool in the fridge for at least four hours before trying to serve it. Creating Vanilla Cheesecake Mix melted butter, cinnamon, 1 tsp (4.2 g) of sugar, and salt in a bowl. The dry ingredients will soak up some of the melted butter. Mix these ingredients together using a spatula or spoon. Continue to mix and fold all ingredients until they are well incorporated. Beat in the sour cream, vanilla extract, and eggs. Add one egg at a time to your mixture. Once the egg has been added, mix it together using a fork or whisk before repeating the process on the next egg. If you have a mechanical mixer or food processor, you can also use that to help blend things together. Fold these ingredients together with the other ingredients until the mixture becomes soft and fluffy. You can also beat the eggs in a separate bowl before adding them to your cream cheese filling for a lighter and fluffier finish. Pour the batter into your pie crust. Pour the filling that you just created into your readily made pie crust. Push the filling around until it's evenly distributed over the crust. Smooth out the top of the cheesecake with a spatula. Fill your slow cooker with a 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) of water. Use 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker and fill the bottom of it with water. The level of the water should only come up a half an inch off the bottom of your slow cooker. Cook the cake in the slow-cooker on high for two hours. Place the pie pan inside of the slow-cooker. Make sure that the pie itself does not get wet from the water. Set the dial on high, cover the cake, and continue to cook it for two hours. If you are scared that your cake will get wet, you can use a meat rack or cooking rack that comes with some slow-cookers to elevate your pie pan out of the water. This rack will fit on the bottom of your slow-cooker. Allow the cake to cool. Let the cake cool inside of the slow-cooker once it's done cooking. Afterward, carefully take it out and let it cool down to room temperature before placing the cake in the refrigerator overnight before serving it. To add a special flair to your cheesecake, top it with fresh fruit or melted chocolate or peanut butter.
sentences: Creating the Graham Cracker Crust Crumble up 12 graham crackers.
Crumble up the graham crackers with 1/4 cup (56.69 g) of sugar in a food processor.
If you don't have a food processor, you can put the ingredients into a zip-lock bag and use a rolling pin to crumble it up into a fine dust.
Sugar will add to the sweetness to your crust and will also help bind the crackers together.
Mix in melted butter.
Transfer the graham crackers and sugar to a large mixing bowl and add 6 tablespoons (85 g) of melted butter to the bowl.
Knead the mixture together with your hands until it thickens.
If it is too crumbly, add a teaspoon of water until it becomes pliable.
Press the crust into a pie pan.
Put the mixture in the middle of a baking pan or pie pan and press down on it to form the crust.
Use your hands to press the mixture firmly and evenly so that it cooks evenly.
Bake the crust at 375 °F (191 °C) for 8 to 10 minutes.
Cook the pie crust until it becomes golden brown.
It should also smell fragrant.
When it's done baking, take it out and allow it to cool for an hour before filling it with your cheesecake filling.
If you plan on making the rest of your cheesecake later, then you can cover it and place it in the refrigerator.
Making Simple Cheesecake Mix the cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and sugar and fold the ingredients together using a spatula or spoon.
Continue mixing until all the ingredients are well incorporated and the cream cheese is soft.
You can also mix things together in a food processor.
Add eggs to the bowl.
Crack one egg at a time and whisk it in the cream cheese and sugar bowl.
Make sure that the eggs are incorporated fully before adding the next egg.
Add two cups of water to the bottom of your slow cooker.
You should use a 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker when making this recipe.
Add water to the bottom of your crock pot and set a rack on the bottom of the cooker.
The water should come up about a half an inch from the bottom of your slow cooker.
Fill your crust with your cheesecake filling.
Take your graham cracker crust and fill it with the cream cheese, eggs, and sugar filling that you just created.
Use a spatula to evenly distribute the filling throughout the crust and to help you level out the top of your cheesecake.
Cook in your slow cooker on high for 2 1/2 hours.
Set the dial on the slow cooker to high and place the lid on it.
Do not lift the lid while the cake cooks or it may come out underdone.
If you pierce the center of the cake with a knife and it has a watery consistency, you'll have to cook your cheesecake longer.
Allow the cheesecake to cool.
Let the cheesecake cool down in your slow cooker for one hour before trying to handle it.
Once it's cooled, take it out and cover it with plastic wrap before putting it in your refrigerator to set.
You should allow your cake to cool in the fridge for at least four hours before trying to serve it.
Creating Vanilla Cheesecake Mix melted butter, cinnamon, 1 tsp (4.2 g) of sugar, and salt in a bowl.
The dry ingredients will soak up some of the melted butter.
Mix these ingredients together using a spatula or spoon.
Continue to mix and fold all ingredients until they are well incorporated.
Beat in the sour cream, vanilla extract, and eggs.
Add one egg at a time to your mixture.
Once the egg has been added, mix it together using a fork or whisk before repeating the process on the next egg.
If you have a mechanical mixer or food processor, you can also use that to help blend things together.
Fold these ingredients together with the other ingredients until the mixture becomes soft and fluffy.
You can also beat the eggs in a separate bowl before adding them to your cream cheese filling for a lighter and fluffier finish.
Pour the batter into your pie crust.
Pour the filling that you just created into your readily made pie crust.
Push the filling around until it's evenly distributed over the crust.
Smooth out the top of the cheesecake with a spatula.
Fill your slow cooker with a 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) of water.
Use 6 to 7-quart (5.67 to 6.62 liter) slow cooker and fill the bottom of it with water.
The level of the water should only come up a half an inch off the bottom of your slow cooker.
Cook the cake in the slow-cooker on high for two hours.
Place the pie pan inside of the slow-cooker.
Make sure that the pie itself does not get wet from the water.
Set the dial on high, cover the cake, and continue to cook it for two hours.
If you are scared that your cake will get wet, you can use a meat rack or cooking rack that comes with some slow-cookers to elevate your pie pan out of the water.
This rack will fit on the bottom of your slow-cooker.
Allow the cake to cool.
Let the cake cool inside of the slow-cooker once it's done cooking.
Afterward, carefully take it out and let it cool down to room temperature before placing the cake in the refrigerator overnight before serving it.
To add a special flair to your cheesecake, top it with fresh fruit or melted chocolate or peanut butter.
